title: Technical Support Executive
description:
The Technical Support Executive will be responsible for providing end\\-to\\-end technical assistance, maintaining system efficiency, and ensuring smooth operation of hardware and software systems. The ideal candidate will be proactive in diagnosing issues, performing updates, and supporting users both on\\-site and remotely to ensure uninterrupted technical functionality.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* System Testing \\& Configuration: Conduct testing and validation of system configurations to ensure operational efficiency and compliance with organizational standards.
* Hardware Support: Install, maintain, and troubleshoot desktops, laptops, peripherals, and related hardware components.
* Software Maintenance: Manage installation, updates, and configuration of software applications; ensure timely upgrades for security and performance optimization.
* User Support: Provide prompt technical assistance to end\\-users and resolve hardware/software\\-related queries efficiently.
* Documentation: Maintain detailed logs of support activities, configurations, and issue resolutions for future reference.
* Troubleshooting: Diagnose and resolve technical issues—both hardware and software—through systematic analysis and effective solutions.
* Collaboration: Coordinate with the IT and operations teams to ensure seamless system performance and minimal downtime.

**Qualifications:**

* Experience: 1 years of experience in a technical support or IT helpdesk role (preferably with on\\-site support exposure). Freshers may also apply.
* Technical Knowledge: Strong understanding of computer hardware, system configurations, and operating systems.
* Software Skills: Proficiency in software installation, updates, and troubleshooting.
* Networking: Basic knowledge of network configuration and connectivity troubleshooting.
* Problem\\-Solving: Excellent analytical and diagnostic abilities with a customer\\-first mindset.
* Communication: Effective verbal and written communication skills to interact with team members and clients.
* Availability: Willingness to provide on\\-site and remote support as required by operational needs.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Diploma or certification in Computer Science, IT, or related technical field.
* Industry certifications such as CompTIA A\\+, Microsoft Certified IT Professional (MCITP), or CCNA are an advantage.
* Experience in network setup, device configuration, and system monitoring tools.

Job Types: Full\\-time, Permanent

Pay: ₹200,000\\.00 \\- ₹300,000\\.00 per year

Benefits:

* Health insurance

Work Location: In person

title: Immigration Consultant
description:
**Job Title:** Immigration Consultant (Sales)

**Location:** WeWork, Berger Delhi One, Sector 16 B, Noida UP  
**Employment Type:** Full\\-time  
**Industry:** International and Corporate Immigration  
**Company:** WeAbide® Immigration Service Pvt Ltd  
**Website:** www.theweabide.com  
**Email:**  nikhil@theweabide.com

**About WeAbide®**

WeAbide® is a trusted leader in international education and immigration solutions, driven by a team of seasoned immigration lawyers, education advisors, IT professionals, and client service experts. Our mission is to deliver personalized and transparent immigration services tailored to the aspirations of professionals, students, and corporate partners across Australia, Canada, the US, and the UK. For over a decade, we have empowered thousands of individuals and businesses through our commitment to excellence and integrity.

**Position Overview**

We are seeking a dynamic, motivated, and results\\-driven **Immigration Consultant (Sales)** to join our growing team. The ideal candidate will have a passion for client service and a strong understanding of immigration pathways and policies. This role focuses on identifying and converting leads, guiding clients through our service offerings, and ensuring a smooth onboarding experience for individuals seeking migration opportunities.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Engage with prospective clients via calls, emails, in\\-person consultations, and digital platforms
* Assess client needs and recommend appropriate immigration services
* Present WeAbide®’s offerings clearly and confidently to drive conversions
* Follow up on leads and nurture long\\-term client relationships
* Maintain accurate records of all client interactions using CRM systems
* Coordinate with internal departments (legal, counseling, case management) to ensure client satisfaction
* Keep updated on changes in immigration policies across Australia, Canada, the US, and the UK
* Meet and exceed monthly and quarterly sales targets

**Key Requirements**

* Bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing, or related field
* 0\\-3 years of experience in immigration consulting, sales, or client relationship management (preferred)
* Strong communication, negotiation, and presentation skills
* Understanding of international immigration and education markets is a plus
* Tech\\-savvy with knowledge of CRM and productivity tools
* Passion for helping clients achieve life\\-changing opportunities
* Self\\-motivated, goal\\-oriented, and team\\-focused

**What We Offer**

* Competitive salary and performance\\-based incentives
* Ongoing training and professional development
* Collaborative and supportive work environment
* Opportunity to work with a respected brand and industry experts
* Career growth within an expanding international company

**Training for Immigration Consultant (Sales) Trainees**

At WeAbide®, we value enthusiasm and potential over prior experience in immigration. We welcome freshers and professionals from non\\-immigration backgrounds who are eager to build a rewarding career in international education and migration services.

While you may already have a basic understanding of immigration systems in countries such as Australia, Canada, the US, or the UK, our structured 3\\-month hands\\-on training program is designed to equip you with the knowledge and skills needed to succeed as an Immigration Executive.

**Training Highlights:**

* **Immigration Law Basics** (Australia, Canada, US, UK)
* **Sales Techniques \\& Client Communication**
* **CRM \\& Technology Tools for Lead Management**
* **Case Handling and Client Engagement Strategies**

**Post\\-Training Opportunity:**

* Based on your performance and skill development, you may be offered a full\\-time permanent position.
* Salary post\\-training will range from ₹18,000 to ₹45,000 per month plus incentives, depending on your capabilities and results.

This is a unique opportunity to launch your career in a fast\\-growing sector with full support from a team of seasoned professionals.

**Join Us**

If you're ready to be part of a mission\\-driven team making a global impact, **apply today** and help shape the future of international talent mobility with **WeAbide®**.

Pay: ₹18,000\\.00 \\- ₹45,000\\.00 per month

* Source and screen candidates through job portals, LinkedIn, and social media platforms.
* Coordinate and schedule interviews between candidates and hiring teams.
* Maintain and update candidate databases and recruitment reports.
* Assist in evaluating candidates based on technical and soft skills.
* Learn and develop expertise in various technology domains and hiring practices.
* Ensure a smooth and positive experience for candidates throughout the hiring process.



  





**Required Skills \\& Qualifications:** 



* Bachelor’s degree in HR, Business Administration, Computer Science, or a related field.
* 0–1 year of experience in recruitment (internship or project experience in IT recruitment preferred).
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Good understanding of IT terminology and technical roles.
* Enthusiasm to learn, multitask, and work in a fast\\-paced environment.



  





**Why Join Us:** 



* Great learning opportunity for fresh graduates interested in HR and recruitment.
* Friendly and supportive work culture.
* Exposure to end\\-to\\-end IT recruitment and global hiring practices.
* Competitive salary with growth and performance incentives.

title: Advisory - Deals - Finance In Deals - Manager
description:
A career in our Financial Due Diligence practice, within Deals Transaction Services, will provide you the opportunity to help organisations realise the potential of mergers, acquisitions and divestitures and capital markets. In short, we help some of the world’s leading companies originate, create, execute, and realise value from deals. Through data driven insights we help our clients move in the right direction ensuring maximum value for their company. Our team assist organisations with both buy side and sell side due diligence. As part of our team, you’ll help us provide both corporate and financial buyers with peace of mind by analysing and validating all the financial, commercial, operational and strategic assumptions being made.
   

  

 To really stand out and make us fit for the future in a constantly changing world, each and every one of us at PwC needs to be a purpose\\-led and values\\-driven leader at every level. To help us achieve this we have the PwC Professional; our global leadership development framework. It gives us a single set of expectations across our lines, geographies and career paths, and provides transparency on the skills we need as individuals to be successful and progress in our careers, now and in the future.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 As a Manager, you'll work as part of a team of problem solvers, helping to solve complex business issues from strategy to execution. PwC Professional skills and responsibilities for this management level include but are not limited to:
   

  

* Develop new skills outside of comfort zone.
* Act to resolve issues which prevent the team working effectively.
* Coach others, recognise their strengths, and encourage them to take ownership of their personal development.
* Analyse complex ideas or proposals and build a range of meaningful recommendations.
* Use multiple sources of information including broader stakeholder views to develop solutions and recommendations.
* Address sub\\-standard work or work that does not meet firm's/client's expectations.
* Use data and insights to inform conclusions and support decision\\-making.
* Develop a point of view on key global trends, and how they impact clients.
* Manage a variety of viewpoints to build consensus and create positive outcomes for all parties.
* Simplify complex messages, highlighting and summarising key points.
* Uphold the firm's code of ethics and business conduct.


**Primary Responsibilities Of The Role**
* Pre\\-Deal (IT Due Diligence):


**OIT Function Assessment**
 ▪Support clients in developing key IT strategies for M\\&A engagements with a focus on IT due diligence across the IT function including IT applications and data, IT infrastructure, IT security and IT organisation (including IT vendors).
   

  

 ▪This involves evaluating IT landscapes to identify synergies and dis\\-synergies, understanding the business's IT transformation vision, and identifying technical inefficiencies.
   

  

 ▪Propose recommendations for the target IT landscape, identify IT\\-related opportunities and risks, and formulate strategies to mitigate them.
   

  

 oIT spend Analysis: Conduct IT spend analysis, including vendor contract reviews to uncover hidden transactional costs, and provide recommendations for cost efficiencies. Perform IT benchmarking for key performance indicators using insights from previous projects and research
   

  

 databases.
   

  

 oSubject Matter Expertise: Provide basic subject matter expertise across one or more of the following critical components of IT landscape:
   

  

 ▪ERP assessment and separation/ integration planning (e.g., SAP etc.)
   

  

 ▪Enterprise Architecture
   

  

 ▪Infrastructure (Servers, Data Center, Storage, Network, End User Computing)
   

  

 ▪Cloud
   

  

 ▪Security and Access Management (Cybersecurity Services, Cyber maturity assessment framework leveraging NIS2 framework)
   

  

 ▪IT Financials in M\\&A and Transformation Scenarios (IT Opex / Capex Cost Modeling)
   

  

* Post\\-Deal (Integration/Separation):


 oIntegration and Separation Planning: Provide support for IT integration and separation activities post\\-deal. This includes planning and readiness for program, integration, and transformation management offices, as well as Day 1/100 readiness planning.
   

  

 oVendor Management: Assist in vendor evaluation and selection, bid formulation, and ongoing vendor management to ensure smooth integration or separation processes.
   

  

 oDigital and Technology Transformation: Advise on large\\-scale transformation engagements by identifying, designing, and implementing creative business and technology solutions. Plan and implement IT integration, separation, and transformation projects, providing advisory and PMO support for enterprise systems like ERP, CRM, and Big Data.
   

  

 oTechnology Implementation: Guide projects involving enterprise application integration and transformation across various components of the IT landscape, ensuring comprehensive solutions are delivered.
   

  

* Additional Requirements:
* Critical problem solving and troubleshooting skills with the ability to exercise mature judgment.
* Ability to use tools outside of traditional methods such as MS excel, PowerPoint, and enable smart working.
* Framing issues and breaking it down into hypotheses to be solved
* Strong oral and written communication skills
* Core consulting skills including (MS Visio, PowerPoint, Excel, Project), story boarding etc.
* Improving internal processes and promoting knowledge sharing in the team.
* Flexibility to travel if required.


**Qualification Required \\-CA/MBA/CFA Fresher \\& Experienced**
**Years of experience:** 
 6\\+ Years

title: Receptionist/Administration
company: The Physios Advance Physiotherapy And Sports Injury Centre
description:
Job Description:

Position Overview:  
We are looking for a highly organized and friendly individual to serve as the face of our clinic and manage administrative tasks. The Receptionist and Administrator will be responsible for handling all front desk duties, including greeting patients, scheduling appointments, managing phone calls and emails, processing payments, and maintaining patient records. Additionally, this role will involve providing administrative support to ensure the smooth operation of the clinic.

Key Responsibilities:

* Greet patients in a warm and professional manner, ensuring they feel welcome and comfortable.
* Schedule appointments for patients, coordinating with physiotherapists to optimize scheduling efficiency.
* Answer phone calls and emails promptly and professionally, providing information and assistance as needed.
* Verify patient insurance coverage and process payments accurately.
* Maintain patient records and ensure all information is up\\-to\\-date and accurate.
* Manage filing systems and organize paperwork to ensure efficient record\\-keeping.
* Assist with billing and invoicing tasks as required.
* Coordinate with other team members to ensure smooth patient flow and efficient clinic operations.
* Keep the reception area clean and organized at all times.
* Provide administrative support to physiotherapists and other staff members as needed.
* Adhere to clinic policies and procedures, including patient confidentiality guidelines.
* Continuously strive to improve customer service and patient satisfaction.

Qualifications:

* High school diploma or equivalent required; additional education or training in office administration or healthcare administration preferred.
* Previous experience in a medical or healthcare setting is highly desirable.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to interact effectively with patients and staff.
* Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
* Proficiency in computer skills, including experience with electronic medical records (EMR) systems and Microsoft Office Suite.
* Ability to multitask and prioritize tasks in a fast\\-paced environment.
* Professional demeanor and positive attitude.
* Ability to maintain confidentiality of patient information.
* CPR certification may be required.

This position offers an exciting opportunity to join a dynamic team and make a positive impact on the lives of our patients. If you are passionate about healthcare and possess the skills and qualities we are looking for, we encourage you to apply.

Job Types: Full\\-time, Fresher, Internship  
Contract length: 24 months

Pay: ₹15,000\\.00 \\- ₹18,000\\.00 per month

title: Database Administrator
description:
A Database Administrator (DBA) is responsible for managing, maintaining, and securing an organization’s database systems to ensure optimal performance, data integrity, and security. They play a central role in ensuring that the company’s data is reliable, available, and efficiently organized for use in business operations and analytics.

Key Responsibilities

* Build, design, and implement database systems according to end\\-user requirements.
* Monitor database performance and tune queries for efficiency.
* Plan and execute backup and recovery operations to safeguard data.
* Maintain data security through access control, encryption, and regular updates.
* Install, configure, and upgrade database management systems (DBMS).
* Collaborate with developers and analysts to optimize database\\-driven applications and business intelligence solutions.
* Document database configurations, policies, and procedures.
* Troubleshoot data integrity and connectivity issues.

Pay: ₹12,536\\.74 \\- ₹42,411\\.07 per month

* Provident Fund

title: LeadSquared CRM Administrator
description:
**Job Title:** LeadSquared CRM Administrator  
**Location:** Noida  
**Experience:** 1–2 Years  
**Salary:** Up to ₹35,000 per month

**Job Summary:**

We are looking for a **LeadSquared CRM Administrator** who will be responsible for managing, configuring, and optimizing our CRM platform to support business processes and automation. The ideal candidate should have a strong understanding of business automation workflows and experience in maintaining CRM data integrity and performance.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Manage and maintain the **LeadSquared CRM** system, ensuring smooth operation and user access.
* Create, update, and optimize **automation workflows**, triggers, and lead management processes.
* Configure lead stages, forms, fields, and reports as per business requirements.
* Monitor CRM performance, troubleshoot issues, and coordinate with the vendor support team when necessary.
* Train and support team members on CRM functionalities and new features.
* Ensure data accuracy and regular clean\\-up of CRM databases.
* Generate and analyze reports to provide business insights and track KPIs.

**Requirements:**

* **Bachelor’s degree** in Computer Science, Business, or related field.
* **1–2 years of experience in LeadSquared CRM administration**.
* Strong understanding of **business process automation** and workflow configuration.
* Good analytical, problem\\-solving, and communication skills.
* Ability to work collaboratively across teams and manage multiple tasks efficiently.

**Preferred Skills:**

* Knowledge of **API integrations** and lead management systems.
* Experience in **marketing/sales automation** tools.
* Basic understanding of **data analytics and reporting tools**.

Job Types: Full\\-time, Permanent, Fresher

Pay: ₹15,244\\.64 \\- ₹35,000\\.00 per month

Benefits:

* Paid time off
* Provident Fund
* Work from home

Application Question(s):

* How many years of experience you do have with Leadsquared CRM ?
* Do you have any automation workflows experience , name them.
* Your Current CTC (Annual)

title: Interns- Electronics Hardware Engineer
description:
**About the Role:**

We’re looking for a driven and passionate Hardware Engineer (Fresher) who is eager to turn ideas into tangible innovations. If you’ve ever looked at a circuit board and thought, “*I can make this better,*” this role is for you. You’ll work closely with our senior engineers in designing, testing, and optimizing next\\-generation electronic systems that power real\\-world solutions.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Assist in designing and developing electronic circuits, PCBs, and embedded hardware systems.
* Collaborate with cross\\-functional teams to bring concepts from prototype to production.
* Perform testing, debugging, and validation of hardware components and boards.

* An analytical mindset with a builder’s curiosity and passion for creating something great out of something simple.
* Self\\-motivated, eager to learn, and unafraid to experiment.

**What You’ll Gain**

* Hands\\-on experience building real hardware from concept to prototype.
* Mentorship from experienced hardware engineers and innovators.
* A creative workspace that values curiosity, initiative, and bold ideas.
* Opportunity to grow into R\\&D, product design, or hardware innovation roles.

**Bonus Traits**

* You’ve built personal electronics projects, tinkered with development boards, or participated in hackathons.
* You can explain how things work—not just that they do.
* You believe hardware isn’t just built—it’s crafted.

title: Network Engineer [T500-21000]
description:
**About McDonald’s:** 




 One of the world’s largest employers with locations in more than 100 countries, McDonald’s Corporation has corporate opportunities in Hyderabad. Our global offices serve as dynamic innovation and operations hubs, designed to expand McDonald's global talent base and in\\-house expertise. Our new office in Hyderabad will bring together knowledge across business, technology, analytics, and AI, accelerating our ability to deliver impactful solutions for the business and our customers across the globe.
 



  





**Restaurant Network Engineer** 




**Job Description:** 




 This opportunity is part of the Global Technology Infrastructure \\& Operations team (GTIO), where our mission is to deliver modern and relevant technology that supports the way McDonald’s works. We provide best\\-in\\-class foundational technology products and services including Global Networking, Cloud, End User Computing, and IT Service Management. It’s our goal to always provide an engaging, relevant, and simple experience for our customers.
 



 Reporting to the Sr. Network Manager, the Network Engineer will be responsible for monitoring network performance, identifying and resolving network issues, and implementing network security measures to protect the organization's data and systems. In addition to technical expertise, the successful candidate will have excellent communication and problem\\-solving skills, as well as the ability to work well in a team environment.
 



 This is an exciting opportunity for a motivated and talented Network Engineer to take on a key role in the organization's technology team and make a meaningful impact on its operations and success.
 



  





**Responsibilities \\& Accountabilities:** 



* Develop, manage and implement a network infrastructure that supports the Restaurant operations, including point\\-of\\-sale systems and other business\\-critical applications.
* Manage and maintain Network hardware, such as Routers, Access Points, Switches, and Firewalls.
* Troubleshoot, Design, implement, test, deploy and maintain innovative Network solutions to transform service performance, durability, cost, and security.
* While embedding with teams, strategize, consult, and prototype alongside other engineers to implement best practices and solutions for applications utilizing the latest Network Technologies.
* Drive proof of concepts and conduct technical feasibility studies for business requirements.
* Remain up to date on emerging technologies and architecture and propose ways to use them in current and upcoming projects.
* Strive to provide world\\-class service to both internal and external customers.
* Effectively communicate project health, risks and issues to the program stakeholders, sponsors and management teams.
* Resolve most conflicts between timeline, budget, and scope independently but intuitively escalate complex or consequential issues to senior management.
* Identify and direct changes through appropriate review and approval mechanisms.
* Work well in an agile environment.
* Responsible for providing urgent support and troubleshooting for our customers outside of regular business hours.



  





**Qualifications:** 



* Willingness and ability to live the McDonald’s values every day: Serve, Inclusion, Integrity, Community, and Family.
* Cisco Professional Level Designation (CCNP Enterprise, CCNP Security, CCNP Data Center, etc.)
* Strong desire to automate everything you touch.
* Must be attentive to details, organized, self\\-motivated, and driven.
* Knowledge and understanding of industry trends and new technologies and ability to apply trends to architectural needs.
* Excellent written and oral communication skills with the ability to communicate effectively with technical and non\\-technical staff.
* Comfortable with ambiguity and ability to navigate uncertainty.
* Demonstrated strong analytic and problem\\-solving abilities.
* Advanced ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.



  





**Preferred Qualifications:** 



* Subject matter expert in many facets of network hardware based on Juniper \\& Meraki platforms and understand intricate network dependencies from edge, core and cloud infrastructure.
* Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills to critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources.
* Ability to design and deploy innovative network solutions that enhance service performance, durability, cost\\-effectiveness, and security.
* Ability to manage stakeholder expectations and resolve conflict.
* Proven experience working in an Agile environment with a Scrum Master, Daily Scrum meetings, Backlogs, Sprints and written Stories and deliverables. Familiar with documentation process and tools, JIRA and Confluence preferred.



  





**Experience:** 



* 5\\+ years of experience with routing and switching technologies.
* 5\\+ years of experience with Meraki and Aruba L2\\&3 switch installation, administration, and management.
* 5\\+ years of experience with Meraki and Aruba wireless solutions and access points.
* 5\\+ years of experience with Network Security.
* Familiar with Meraki Dashboard
 
 and Juniper Mist Dashboard and know how to use configuration template.
* Bachelor’s degree or three years relevant experience.
* Knowledge of networking protocols such as OSPF, BGP, VTP, TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP, LAN/WAN, and VPN design.
* Experience with Palo Alto firewalls, Palo Alto Prisma (cloud\\-based version).
* Experience with Microsoft Active Directory.
* Experience with VMware solutions.
* Experience with SolarWinds or equivalent network monitoring solutions.

title: Network Administrator
description:
**Join our Team**
 About this opportunity:
   

  

 We are currently seeking a talented and dedicated individual to join our Ericsson team as a Technical Authority Expert. This critical role belongs to our Managed Services department, directly contributing to our ongoing Ericsson Operations Engine projects. You will be at the forefront of tech\\-driven change, offering your specialist knowledge to guide the entire lifecycle of our projects. Whether we are in the Create, Sustain, or Evolve stages, your expertise will pave the way forward in your domain.
   

  

 What you will do:
   

  

 Operations responsibility for Daily health checks of network elements, such as switches, firewalls, routers, load balancers, IPS and related elements.
   

  

 Responsible to maintain network elements on a supported software levels which included performing software upgrade and hardware refresh
   

  

 Participate in maintaining IP addressing, network diagrams, traffic flows and Firewall policies and related documents
   

  

 Perform baseline \\& ad hoc configurational changes on various network elements.
   

  

 Create Method of Procedure (MOP) documentation and coordinate and execute proactive and reactive maintenance activities with change request.
   

  

 Perform firewall policy changes using planned change request and MOP
   

  

 Responsible of handing trouble \\& problem tickets, recovering all incidents and troubleshoot operation issues
   

  

 Must be able to be on\\-call 24x7 to support escalations and outages.
   

  

 The skills you bring:
   

  

 Experience with enterprise switching technologies, including link negotiation, VLANs, trucking, inter\\-VLAN routing, port aggregation, and fault isolation is required.
   

  

 Experience with enterprise routing technologies, including static and dynamic routing, routing protocols (OSPF and/or BGP required), and fault isolation is required.
   

  

 Experience with VPN technology, including configuration, monitoring, and fault isolation is required.
   

  

 Experience with packet capture hardware/software to support fault isolation is required.
   

  

 Open to being on call outside of regular working hours as well as occasional nights and weekends.
   

  

 Enterprise level experience with security solutions such as IPSEC VPNs, SSL VPNs, IPS, etc. is preferred.
   

  

 Hand\\-on Experience with Extreme switches and F5 load balancer is needed.
   

  

 Hands\\-on experience with firewalls, including Juniper \\& Palo Alto is needed.
   

  

 Hands\\-on experience on AWS and Azure cloud is a plus.
   

  

**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

 India (IN) \\|\\| Bangalore

title: Cloud Network Engineer
description:
Azure is one of the fastest growing businesses in Microsoft’s history and is the foundation of Microsoft’s commercial Cloud Services. Azure differentiates itself as the only hyper\\-scale, enterprise\\-grade cloud with a true hybrid story. Customers and analysts recognize Azure’s tremendous momentum which continues month over month.  Microsoft Azure’s core priority is to be world's most trusted, secure, and global cloud and a great place for people to work. We are part of the Azure Networking team responsible for designing, building, and operating the most reliable cloud network in the world \\- Azure.
   

  

 We are looking for a passionate, high\\-energy individual to help build the network that powers the world’s largest online services. For this position, the candidate should be familiar with network protocols, network devices including network interface cards, switches, and routers. You should feel comfortable working with large\\-scale distributed systems, in managing the network infrastructure that supports the Azure Cloud infrastructure as well as in designing and building the large\\-scale distributed systems that manage the network.
   

  

 Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Contribute to testing and validation of network devices and assist in managing network deployments within a team of engineers.
* Provide instructions to data center or network site technicians on repairing, replacing, and maintaining physical network hardware in production environments.
* Seek mentorship, feedback, and coaching to continuously improve technical skills and professional growth.
* Develop foundational knowledge of network technologies to support design, implementation, and operational decisions.
* Assist in designing reliable, scalable, and high\\-performance network features or components under guidance from senior engineers.
* Support the creation of Bills of Materials (BoMs) and help translate high\\-level infrastructure designs into actionable low\\-level plans.
* Monitor network telemetry and perform basic failure analysis, while identifying process or tooling deficiencies and proposing improvements with guidance.


**Qualifications**
**Required/Minimum Qualifications:**
* 2\\+ years technical experience in network design, development, and automation
+ OR Bachelor's Degree in Electrical Engineering, Optical Engineering, Computer Science, Information Technology,
+ OR related field AND 2\\+ years technical experience in network design, development, and automation
+ OR Master's Degree in Electrical Engineering, Optical Engineering, Computer Science, Information Technology,
+ OR related field.

* 2\\+ years of experience in the networking Industry or large\\-scale data center network.
* 1\\+ years experience working with L2/L3 switching platforms, and knowledge of network protocols like BGP, ISIS, MPLS, OSPF, VRRP, LACP, Traffic Engineering and their use.
+ Troubleshooting basic problems of BGP, ISIS , MPLS etc in large ISP/Carrier/Data Center network.
+ Knowledge of Datacenter Design (Control plane \\& Data Plane) \\& Operations

* 1\\+ years experience working in large scale data center/cloud environment with an understanding of passive components (UTP Cabling, Optical cabling).
* 1\\+ years experience in one or more programming languages: C\\+\\+, Java, Python, Perl.
* 1\\+ years xperience in understanding and authoring machine readable formats like XML, JSON.


**Additional Or Preferred Qualifications**
* 1\\+ years experience in debugging and troubleshooting deep network issues and drafting root cause analysis reports.
* Excellent communication skills and team player with ability to build solid relationships at all levels, across teams, geographies, and business functions.
* Networking certification will be a plus.


**Other Qualifications**

title: Cloud Network Engineer
description:
Azure is one of the fastest growing businesses in Microsoft’s history and is the foundation of Microsoft’s commercial Cloud Services. Azure differentiates itself as the only hyper\\-scale, enterprise\\-grade cloud with a true hybrid story. Customers and analysts recognize Azure’s tremendous momentum which continues month over month.  Microsoft Azure’s core priority is to be world's most trusted, secure, and global cloud and a great place for people to work. We are part of the Azure Networking team responsible for designing, building, and operating the most reliable cloud network in the world \\- Azure.
   

  

 We are looking for a passionate, high\\-energy individual to help build the network that powers the world’s largest online services. For this position, the candidate should be familiar with network protocols, network devices including network interface cards, switches, and routers. You should feel comfortable working with large\\-scale distributed systems, in managing the network infrastructure that supports the Azure Cloud infrastructure as well as in designing and building the large\\-scale distributed systems that manage the network.
   

  

 Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Collaborate with internal business units and stakeholders to understand requirements and deliver solutions efficiently from design to implementation.
* Automate repetitive tasks to reduce implementation time and minimize human error, solving network problems at cloud scale with an automation mindset.
* Participate in on\\-call rotations for network incident support, using software\\-enabled tools to quickly mitigate impact and restore service availability.
* Troubleshoot live site issues with minimal disruption, validate network devices, identify and locate necessary data, and guide data center teams on hardware maintenance.
* Evangelize best practices in network engineering across teams and contribute to postmortem and root\\-cause analysis to improve reliability.
* Share timely, audience\\-tailored information across disciplines and provide feedback and mentorship while actively seeking the same from peers.
* Demonstrate strong knowledge of network standards and automation, ensuring efficient project execution and continuous improvement.


**Qualifications**
**Required/Minimum Qualifications:**
* 2\\+ years technical experience in network design, development, and automation
+ OR Bachelor's Degree in Electrical Engineering, Optical Engineering, Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology, or related field.
+ OR related field AND 2\\+ years technical experience in network design, development, and automation
+ OR Master's Degree in Electrical Engineering, Optical Engineering, Computer Science, Information Technology,
+ OR related field.


* 
+

* In depth understanding of signal propagation and impairments in Optical fiber and various fiber types, transceiver hardware used at Client and Line end of transmission equipment
* Knowledge of DWDM and various modulation techniques used for transporting high speed client demands such as 100GE,400GE and beyond on Coherent and PAM4
* Good understanding of Optical Control Plane, Optical feedback loops, Optical network health parameters (e.g. OSNR, BER, Q\\-factor etc), L0/L1 protection schemes used in Optical transport

* Implement modern telemetry and drive a standardized schema for event/alarms and pms in multi\\-vendor environment

* Excellent communication skills and team player with ability to build solid relationships at all levels, across teams, geographies, and business functions.
* Experience in solving broad business problems and analytical skills.

title: Network Engineer
description:
**Company Description**
 BETSOL is a cloud\\-first digital transformation and data management company offering products and IT services to enterprises in over 40 countries. BETSOL team holds several engineering patents, is recognized with industry awards, and BETSOL maintains a net promoter score that is 2x the industry average. BETSOL’s open\\-source backup and recovery product line, Zmanda (Zmanda.com), delivers up to 80% savings in total cost of ownership (TCO) and best\\-in\\-class performance. BETSOL Global IT Services (BETSOL.com) builds and supports end\\-to\\-end enterprise solutions, reducing time\\-to\\-market for its customers. BETSOL offices are set against the vibrant backdrops of Broomfield, Colorado and Bangalore, India. We take pride in being an employee\\-centric organization, offering comprehensive health insurance, competitive salaries, 401K, volunteer programs, and scholarship opportunities. Office amenities include a fitness center, cafe, and recreational facilities. Learn more at betsol.com.
   

  

**Job Description**
 Design, plan, manage and support network infrastructure components across enterprise locations and cloud environments, ensuring security, availability and scalability of network services.
   

  

 Responsibilities:
   

  

* Designing, Planning, Managing and Supporting Network Infrastructure in a Global Enterprise.
* Expert level knowledge of Network solutions (including but not limited to: Cisco, VOIP, Palo Alto, BigIP F5, etc.). Familiarity/experience with Azure networking is a plus.
* Enterprise based knowledge on supporting Routing and Switching protocols, Firewall and Network Security, LAN/WAN/MAN, wireless, SDWAN, VoIP, VPN access, and Internet routing.
* Network Authentication and On\\-Boarding access to include RSA, Identity Services Engine, and Cloud Operations.
* Perform troubleshooting analysis of Network for client offices while working closely with one or more of the following groups:
* Other departments/business units within the Global Organization
* Global IT Staff
* Vendors/Service Providers
* Recommend improvements to enhance the technical capabilities of the network solutions and services and to reduce operating costs.
* Create and Maintain Network Services documentation (Network Diagrams, Work Instructions and SOPs, etc.)
* Provide technical guidance to Network team members for trouble ticket completion and infrastructure configuration.
* Document network challenges, problems and resolution for future reference.
* Identify areas of improvement and provide recommendations on improving Network Infrastructure.
* Manage, guide and mentor the efforts of the entire Network Services Team supporting and troubleshooting network and many times the services utilizing the network.
* Provide performance, capacity, inventory and licensing reports on the Network
* Review network designs provided by external vendor partners to ensure operational efficiency and escalate any concerns on proposed designs to team management.


**Qualifications**
* Bachelor’s degree preferred or equivalent experience
* 3\\-5 years enterprise networking environments experience
* Proven experience in Network Solutions (Cisco, VOIP, Palo Alto, BigIP F5, etc.).
* Certifications: CCNA (required); CCNP desired.
* Ability to work in a fast\\-paced environment
* Ability to work independently and cross\\-collaboration
* The ability to independently troubleshoot complex issues and demonstrate strong self\\-starting capabilities
* Ability to make quick decisions
* Customer focused and service oriented
* Very strong analytical abilities and professional office experience required

title: Network Engineer
description:
**About The Role**
 The Technology Team at GLG builds the platform that matches companies around the world with experts who can help them make the right call on their most important decisions.  GLG is building a next generation platform to transform our industry, and we’re looking for people to help define and build our network infrastructure. Joining GLG’s Global Network Engineering team, you’ll collaborate with other network engineers, systems architects, software engineers, product managers, and users to set and achieve goals that help GLG continue to define the future of expertise.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Support for the company’s Global wired, wireless and Cloud infrastructure.
* Optimize stability, availability, reliability, and performance of networking infrastructure.
* Assist in resolving escalated incidents from and in collaboration with our production support team
* Utilize configuration and deployment tools shared across the org, including initial and ongoing support.
* Actively communicate current issues, upcoming changes, etc. to staff/users
* Find opportunities for improvement within the network and make recommendations based on best practices and observations.
* Develop and maintain support, maintenance, procedural, and other documentation.


**Key Responsibilities**
* Administration /Support of LAN/WAN
* Administration /Support of Wireless Network
* Administration /Support of Firewall/VPN/PaloAlto/Panorama
* Working with Carriers and Communication Providers on circuits delivery
* Administration of cloud\\-based network and security services – AWS / Azure / CloudFlare / WAF


**Knowledge And Skills**
 Strong hands\\-on experience with:
   

  

* LAN/WAN technologies throughout a Global Infrastructure
* Firewall/VPN (Palo Alto, Panorama)
* Switches – Cisco Catalyst/Nexus, Meraki switches
* Meraki WiFi implementation
* AWS Cloud Network and Security architecture


**Strong Understanding Of The Following Concepts/technologies**
* L2/L3 LAN/WAN technologies such as TCP/IP, BGPv4, EIGRP, OSPF, Route Redistribution, HSRP, STP, LACP, VPC, NAT, DNS
* 802\\.11a/b/g/n/ac/ax, RF, and WLAN fundamentals
* user authentication, authorization and Identity management products and technologies such as 802\\.1x, TACACS, Radius, and Cisco ISE.
* Packet capturing tools
* Network Monitoring tools (such as SolarWinds, Logic Monitor, Manage Engine)
* Scripting and automation experience – Python, Ansible, Terraform desired.


**About GLG / Gerson Lehrman Group**
 GLG is the world’s insight network. Our clients rely on GLG’s global team to connect with powerful insight across fields from our network of approximately 1 million experts (and the hundreds of new experts we recruit every day).
   

  

 We serve thousands of the world’s best businesses, from Fortune 500 corporations to leading technology companies to professional services firms and financial institutions. We connect our clients to the world’s largest and most varied source of first\\-hand expertise, including executives, scientists, academics, former public\\-sector leaders, and the foremost subject matter specialists.
   

  

 GLG’s industry\\-leading compliance framework allows clients to learn in a structured, auditable, and transparent way, consistent with their own internal compliance obligations and the highest professional ethical standards. Our compliance standards are a major competitive differentiator and key component of the company’s culture.
   

  

 To learn more, visit www.GLGinsights.com.
   

  

 Gerson Lehrman Group, Inc. (“GLG”) is an equal opportunity employer and will not discriminate against any employee or applicant on the basis of age, race, religion, color, marital status, disability, gender, national origin, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any classification protected by federal, state, or local law.

title: Senior Network Engineer, NOC Services
description:
Kaseya® is the leading provider of complete IT infrastructure and security management solutions for Managed Service Providers (MSPs) and internal IT organizations worldwide powered by AI. Kaseya’s best\\-in\\-breed technologies allow organizations to efficiently manage and secure IT to drive sustained business success. Kaseya has achieved sustained, strong double\\-digit growth over the past several years and is backed by Insight Venture Partners www.insightpartners.com), a leading global private equity firm investing in high\\-growth technology and software companies that drive transformative change in the industries they serve.
   

  

 Founded in 2000, Kaseya currently serves customers in over 20 countries across a wide variety of industries and manages over 15 million endpoints worldwide. To learn more about our company and our award\\-winning solutions, go to www.Kaseya.com and for more information on Kaseya’s culture.
   

  

 Kaseya is not your typical company. We are not afraid to tell you exactly who we are and our expectations. The thousands of people that succeed at Kaseya are prepared to go above and beyond for the betterment of our customers.
   

  

 Senior Engineer IMS, NOC Services
   

  

**What We Are Looking For**
 We are currently in the process of recruiting a seasoned Senior Engineer IMS with 6\\-8 years of relevant experience. The primary responsibility of this role is to ensure that our customers extract the utmost value from Kaseya’s products and services. The ideal candidate should exhibit strong technical capabilities in network IT and remote Windows system infrastructure. Additionally, exceptional English fluency and the ability to troubleshoot effectively are crucial for this role.
   

  

**Required Skills**
 The candidate should have 6\\-8 years of relevant experience in a senior technical support or systems administration role, with a focus on network IT, remote Windows systems, and NOC environments. They should have a proven track record of successfully troubleshooting and resolving a wide range of complex technical issues. They should possess a deep understanding of Windows Server operating systems, including aspects such as configuration, security, automation, and patch management. They should have a strong grasp of network IT concepts, including network protocols, routing, switching, and security best practices. They should demonstrate expertise in using remote Windows system infrastructure management tools (e.g., Kaseya Products) for efficient monitoring and management. They should have in\\-depth knowledge of Network Operation Center (NOC) best practices and procedures for incident management and resolution. They should exhibit excellent communication and interpersonal skills to effectively collaborate with customers, internal teams, and junior engineers. They should possess strong leadership skills with the ability to mentor and guide junior team members. They should have the ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks simultaneously in a fast\\-paced environment. They should demonstrate a commitment to providing exceptional customer service and maintaining high levels of professionalism. They should be willing to work in a 24/7 environment with rotational shifts. This role requires a 100% in\\-office presence and involves 24\\*7 shift work at our Bengaluru office location in India.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 As a Senior Engineer NOC Services, it is imperative to ensure compliance with service level objectives (SLOs) and maintain comprehensive case and Root Cause Analysis (RCA) documentation. The role involves adhering to Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and escalation instructions while simultaneously assisting multiple customers and environments. It is crucial to understand the impact of issues on customers and prioritize or escalate them as needed. A high degree of professionalism must be maintained in every customer interaction. The role requires you to act as the primary owner for all endpoint issues and alerts triggered from managed machines or internal servers. This involves performing alert verification, troubleshooting, and management for systems, and closing tickets within defined processes. Updating the internal knowledge base with added support solutions as required is also part of the role. Tasks assigned by Tech Leads/Managers on customer\\-facing issues need to be completed promptly. The role involves managing multiple tickets/tasks across server, desktop, and application issues and resolving them based on priority. Providing mentorship to junior team members and offering technical guidance as needed is also a key aspect of this role.
   

  

**Essential Duties And Responsibilities**
* Lead and oversee the daily operations of the IMS environment, ensuring optimal performance, stability, and security.
* Proactively identify, troubleshoot, and resolve complex technical issues across servers, workstations, and network devices.
* Analyze system logs, event data, crash dumps, and other application logs to pinpoint root causes of problems.
* Develop and implement efficient troubleshooting procedures and best practices for the NOC environment.
* Create and maintain clear and concise documentation of incidents, resolutions, and root cause analysis (RCA) to ensure knowledge transfer.
* Adhere to established Service Level Agreements (SLAs) for exceptional customer support.
* Manage and escalate critical customer issues effectively through established runbooks and procedures.
* Provide technical support and guidance to customers experiencing complex IT problems.
* Mentor and guide junior team members, fostering their technical skills and knowledge.
* Participate in continuous learning activities to stay up to date on the latest technologies and best practices.
* Contribute to the continuous improvement of the IMS environment through automation and optimization initiatives.


**What You’ll Bring**
* 6\\-8 years of relevant work experience in the field of network IT and remote Windows system infrastructure.
* Demonstrated experience in adhering to Service Level Objectives (SLOs) and maintaining clear case and Root Cause Analysis (RCA) documentation.
* Proficiency in following multiple Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and escalation instructions.
* Excellent skills in prioritization and escalation based on customer impact.
* High level of professionalism in interactions with customers.
* Strong leadership skills with the ability to mentor and guide junior team members.
* Exceptional troubleshooting skills for a variety of system issues.
* Effective verbal and written communication skills.
* Willingness to work in a 24x7 environment with rotational shifts.


 If this sounds like the right career to fit your personality and interests, please apply, we are looking forward to meeting you!
   

  

 Join the Kaseya growth rocket ship!
   

  

 Join the Kaseya growth rocket ship and see how we are \\#ChangingLives !
   

  

**Additional Information**
*Kaseya provides equal employment opportunity to all employees and applicants without regard to race, religion, age, ancestry, gender, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, veteran status, marital status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.*

 Job Description for L3:
 




 Team Leadership and Management:
 



 Lead and mentor the L2 network support team, ensuring that they adhere to operational standards, follow best practices, and deliver timely solutions to network issues.
 



 Provide guidance and training to team members on advanced troubleshooting techniques, network architecture, and technologies.
 



 Assign tasks and responsibilities to L2 engineers and monitor their progress.
 



 Conduct performance reviews and identify opportunities for skills development within the team.
 



 Network Troubleshooting and Issue Resolution:
 



 Serve as the primary point of escalation for complex network issues that cannot be resolved by L2 engineers.
 



 Troubleshoot and resolve advanced network problems related to LAN, WAN, VPN, firewalls, routers, switches, and other critical network infrastructure components.
 



 Work closely with L3 teams for complex network configurations and escalations.
 



  





 Network Design and Implementation:
 



 Assist in the design, configuration, and implementation of network infrastructure upgrades or expansions.
 



 Collaborate with senior engineers to develop network plans, including hardware selection, network topology, and capacity planning.
 



 Ensure the implementation of network changes follows best practices and minimizes network downtime.
 



  





 Performance Monitoring and Optimization:
 



 Oversee the monitoring of network performance using tools like SolarWinds, Nagios, or PRTG.
 



 Analyze performance metrics and identify areas for optimization.
 



 Implement performance improvements, including load balancing, route optimization, and network segmentation.
 



  





 Network Security Oversight:
 



 Ensure that network security protocols are followed and assist with configuring firewalls, VPNs, ACLs, and other security measures.
 



 Monitor the network for security threats and coordinate with security teams to mitigate risks.
 



 Assist in incident response and post\\-mortem analysis for security incidents.
 



  





 Documentation and Reporting:
 



 Maintain comprehensive and up\\-to\\-date documentation on network configurations, diagrams, IP addressing schemes, and troubleshooting processes.
 



  






 Job Description for L2:
 




 We are seeking a highly skilled L2 Network Engineer with a strong background in network troubleshooting, Palo Alto firewalls, FTD, ASA, Aruba switch, Cisco switching, static routing and PBR. The ideal candidate should have hands\\-on experience in designing, implementing, and maintaining enterprise\\-level network infrastructure, ensuring high availability, performance, and security.
 



  





 Key Responsibilities:
 



 Perform advanced L2\\-level troubleshooting for network incidents and outages.
 



 Manage, configure, and maintain Palo Alto firewalls, FTD , ASA including security policies, NAT, VPNs, and threat prevention.
 



 Deploy, configure, and troubleshoot Aruba /cisco switches (access, distribution, and core layers).
 



 Implement and manage static routing \\& PBR across the network environment.
 



 Monitor network performance and conduct regular tuning for optimal throughput and reliability.
 



 Collaborate with the all team to ensure proper firewall and network policy configurations.
 



 Perform network upgrades, firmware patches, and change management procedures.
 



 Maintain detailed documentation of configurations, network diagrams, and incident reports.
 



 Participate in on\\-call rotations and provide escalation support for critical issues.

title: Network Engineer
description:
**Responsibilities**
 We are seeking a skilled and motivated Network Engineer to design, implement, maintain, and support our growing network infrastructure. The role is responsible for ensuring the stability, integrity, and high availability of network services, supporting both on\\-premises and cloud environments, while aligning with business goals and IT security standards.

title: Associate | Senior Network Engineer [T500-20981]
description:
**About Deutsche Börse Group:** 




 Headquartered in Frankfurt, Germany, Deutsche Börse Group is a leading international exchange organization and market infrastructure provider. They empower investors, financial institutions, and companies by facilitating access to global capital markets.
 



 Their India centre is located in Hyderabad, serves as a key strategic hub and comprises India’s top\\-tier tech talent. They focus on crafting advanced IT solutions that elevate market infrastructure and services. Deutsche Börse Group in India is composed of a team of capital market engineers forming the backbone of financial markets worldwide.
 



  





**Your responsibilities:** 



* Deploy, maintain, and operate the non\\-trading network infrastructure (switches, routers and wireless access points) in strict adherence with the defined procedures with the aim of highest operational stability.
* Monitor and manage incoming support tickets related to network issues, performance, and connectivity, performing timely troubleshooting to identify root causes and implement effective solutions
* Execute, maintain and improve the operational processes and activities, deliver according to the highest quality and standards, ensuring high service delivery levels, compliance and customer satisfaction.
* Conduct incident investigation, communication and resolution.
* Perform out of business hours support activities and participate to on\\-call rotation.
* Create, maintain and report KPIs.
* Support internal and external audits activities, as well as resolution of findings.
* Strictly adhere to corporate processes, standards, policies and operational procedures.
* Investigate and implement operations automation where relevant.



  





**Your profile:** 



* A university degree in Information Technology, electronics, engineering or comparable.
* Excellent knowledge of the following solutions and technologies: Cisco Switches, Routers, Wireless Access Points, ACI and ISE.
* Excellent knowledge of routing and switching protocols (IS\\-IS, BGP, OSPF)
* Strong expertise in Information Technology, specifically with network and connectivity in a hybrid cloud network environment (GCP \\& Azure).
* Experience with automation tools (e.g., Ansible, Python scripting).
* Hands\\-on experience with Terraform for network resource provisioning.
* Very strong customer\\-oriented mindset and attitude, experience in interacting with both internal and external customers.
* Previous experience (around 5 years) in a similar role operating a complex and highly critical network infrastructure within a financial environment.
* Very good analytical skills and structured thinking.
* Very well organized, autonomous, committed to quality, high sense of responsibility and ownership.
* Full proficiency in written and spoken English.

title: Senior Network Engineer, Routing and Switching
description:
**Senior Network Engineer**
 Any where in India \\| Remote \\| Routing and Switching expertise
   

  

**Why Pythian**
 At Pythian, we are experts in strategic database and analytics services, driving digital transformation and operational excellence. Pythian, a multinational company, was founded in 1997 and started by ensuring the reliability and performance of mission\\-critical databases. We quickly earned a reputation for solving tough data challenges. We were there when the industry moved from on\\-premises to cloud environments, and as enterprises sought more from their data, we expanded our competencies to include advanced analytics.
   

  

 Today, we empower organizations to embrace transformation and leverage advanced technologies, including AI, to stay competitive. We deliver innovative solutions that meet each client’s data goals and have built strong partnerships with Google Cloud, AWS, Microsoft, Oracle, SAP, and Snowflake. The powerful combination of our extensive expertise in data and cloud and our ability to keep on top of the latest bleeding edge technologies make us the perfect partner to help mid and large\\-sized businesses transform to stay ahead in today’s rapidly changing digital economy.
   

  

**Why You**
 As a Network Engineer, you will be responsible for providing 24/7 network support to clients across the globe. We are looking for candidates with a proven track record and enthusiasm for working in a fast\\-paced environment, particularly those experienced in enterprise network operations and handling escalations and severe cases.
   

  

 If this is you, and you wonder what it would be like to work at Pythian, reach out to us and find out!
   

  

 Intrigued to see what a life is like at Pythian? Check out \\#pythianlife on
 **LinkedIn** 
 and follow
 **@loveyourdata** 
 on Instagram!
   

  

 Not the right job for you? Check out what other great jobs Pythian has open around the world!
 **Pythian Careers**
**What You Will Be Doing**
* Administration and management of complex networking solutions in enterprise data centers and remote offices across the globe.
* Extensive working experience on Cisco Catalyst and Nexus switches, along with Cisco ISR Routers.
* Expert knowledge of ARP, MAC Address Table, VLAN, Spanning Tree Protocol, Ether channel, Switch Stacking, HSRP/VRRP, Access Lists (ACL), and NAT.
* Hands\\-on experience in Enterprise LAN and WAN configuration and troubleshooting.
* Strong knowledge of networking fundamentals, including TCP/IP, BGP, OSPF, MPLS, VPN technologies (IPSec, GRE), and routing/switching principles.
* Hands\\-on experience in implementing security measures like access control lists (ACLs) and firewall policies to protect the network
* Must have experience in enterprise network operation in handling escalation and severity cases.
* Coordination with ISP, clients and onsite technical teams for troubleshooting network and security incidents.
* Providing permanent remediation for affected endpoints in our network environment
* Documenting network issues related to Incidents with in\\-depth event logs, RCA, and evidence
* IOS/firmware upgrade in Cisco network devices as and when required
* Good to have experience on configuring and troubleshooting CISCO wireless controllers, Aerohive Products.
* Independently drive P2/P1 Technical calls from the network's end, demonstrating exceptional communication and problem\\-solving skills to de\\-escalate situations and provide clear, concise updates to clients.
* Excellent client\\-facing communication skills and the ability to handle and manage client interactions and escalations independently, ensuring client satisfaction and timely resolution of critical issues.
* Work in a billable environment and achieve those targets associated with your position.


**What do we need from you?**
* 5 \\- 10 years of experience in implementing and managing multi\\-vendor network solutions.
* Expert\\-level experience in Routing and Switching.
* Prior experience collaborating with global clients from the US, Europe, and APAC regions
* Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with a proven ability to manage client expectations and handle high\\-pressure situations effectively.
* Must be able to effectively handle multiple projects simultaneously
* Strong analytical and problem\\-solving skills, with a focus on delivering effective solutions and managing client escalations efficiently.
* CCNA or CCNP Certifications are an asset


**What do you get in return?**
* Love your career: Competitive total rewards and salary package. Blog during work hours; take a day off and volunteer for your favorite charity.
* Love your work/life balance: Flexibly work remotely from your home, there’s no daily travel requirement to an office! All you need is a stable internet connection.
* Love your coworkers: Collaborate with some of the best and brightest in the industry!
* Love your development: Hone your skills or learn new ones with our substantial training allowance; participate in professional development days, attend training, become certified, whatever you like!
* Love your workspace: We give you all the equipment you need to work from home including a laptop with your choice of OS, and an annual budget to personalize your work environment!
* Love yourself: Pythian cares about the health and well\\-being of our team. You will have an annual wellness budget to make yourself a priority (use it on gym memberships, massages, fitness and more). Additionally, you will receive a generous amount of paid vacation and sick days, as well as a day off to volunteer for your favorite charity.


**Disclaimer**
 The successful applicant will need to fulfill the requirements necessary to obtain a background check.
   

  

 Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in any aspect of the selection process.
   

  

 As part of the application process Pythian may send you a technical assessment by a third\\-party service provider. This assessment is used to evaluate your technical skills which is necessary for the purposes of the legitimate interests of Pythian Services Inc. and will require us to share your name and email address with our third\\-party provide.
   

  

 We may use artificial intelligence (AI) tools to support parts of the hiring process, such as reviewing applications, analyzing resumes, or assessing responses. These tools assist our recruitment team but do not replace human judgment. Final hiring decisions are ultimately made by humans. If you would like more information about how your data is processed, please contact us.

title: Senior Network Engineer
description:
**Overview**
 We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Network Engineer to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a minimum of 8 years of experience in network engineering and a strong background in working with Cisco ACI, NDFC, BGP, and security protocols.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Design, implement, and maintain advanced routing and switching solutions, including BGP, VXLAN, EVPN, MPLS, and MP\\-BGP.
* Subject Matter Expertise to design and deliver enterprise SD WAN solutions.
* Configure and manage DCI (Data Center Interconnect) connectivity for seamless data transfer between geographically dispersed locations.
* Managing Cloud connectivity from On Prem
* Develop and implement network automation strategies using scripting and other automation tools.
* Monitor network performance, troubleshoot complex network issues, and proactively identify potential problems before they affect users.
* Provide technical expertise and support to other engineers and internal stakeholders.
* Stay up\\-to\\-date with the latest networking technologies and trends.
* Actively participate in projects and initiatives to improve network efficiency and reliability.


**Qualifications**
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.

title: Senior Network Engineer
description:
***Description:***
 We are looking for a
 **Senior Network Engineer** 
 to join our team in one of today’s most exciting technologies. This role is responsible for supporting daily operations of the IT infrastructure services. In addition, the Engineer will participate with the installation, monitoring, maintenance, support, and optimization of all system hardware, software, and communication links. This individual will also analyze and resolve system hardware and software problems in a timely and accurate fashion, and provide end user training.
   

  

**Role and Responsibilities:**
* Role will be involved 24/7 Resource with Good Communication Skills \\& Handled Global Customer
* Confirms and troubleshoots all alerts from remote monitoring tools, Inbound Care, Ops, or Dev and works to resolve all L2 issues related with our data center, cloud environments, network infrastructure, hardware and/or applications.
* Monitoring the performance and capacity of computer systems.
* Performing regular checks on network, System hardware and software.
* Responding to network alerts and hardware malfunctions.
* Diagnosing and troubleshooting network errors.
* Tracking and documenting network issues and compiling incident reports.
* Manages Incident Communications regarding any Outages, Major Incidents, or Service Center Issues to Ops Managers and other appropriate teams or personnel within SLA (Service Level Agreement) parameters. Performs timely notification updates to middle and senior management electronically and via telephone for extended outages and Maintenance Windows.
* Regularly participates in the Shift Handover process with previous and incoming shift teams to help sync and transfer any ongoing issues or outages.
* Available for on\\-call and emergency response rotation as needed.
* Managed control protocols for LAN / WAN infrastructure.
* Ensure proper DHCP, DNS, IP, Firewall, VPN, and server configuration for customer networks.
* Develop and maintain operational documentation.
* Install and update software patches as required.
* Monitor systems health and makes recommendations for additional resources and hardware.
* Candidate must have experience and willingness to share 24x7 support responsibilities with other members of the IT team.


**Skills and Experience:**
* 4\\+ years’ experience in NOC Analysts
* End User support
* Strong knowledge on Network and Systems technologies
* Exceptional interpersonal, oral and written communication skills.
* Proficient knowledge of Windows and Linux operating systems.
* Experience with Infrastructure as a service.
* Experience in installing, configuring and supporting servers.
* Basic network administration skills
* NOC operation
* Prior experience with working in Windows/Linux Server environment.
* CCNA and MCSE Certification Would Be added Advantage.


***Personal Characteristics***
* Optimistic attitude
* Communicate effectively
* Professional and ethical behavior
* Problem solver
* Self\\-motivated
* Good listener
* Must manage time efficiently and effectively


**Educational Requirements**
* Bachelor’s degree in Engineering from an accredited college or university with major course work in Information Science, Computer Science, etc. Master’s degree is a plus.
* 4\\+ years in NOC L1 Analysts to Supporting infrastructure experience in a diverse range of technology environment

title: Cloud Network Engineer II
description:
Azure is the fastest growing business in Microsoft’s history and is the foundation of Microsoft’s commercial Cloud Services. Azure differentiates itself as the only hyper\\-scale, enterprise\\-grade cloud with a true hybrid story. Customers and analysts recognize Azure’s tremendous momentum which continues month over month.  Microsoft Azure’s core priority is to be world's most trusted, secure, and global cloud and a great place for people to work. We are part of the Azure Networking team responsible for designing, building, and operating the most reliable cloud network in the world \\- Azure.
   

  

 We are looking for a passionate, high\\-energy individual to help build the network that powers the world’s largest online services. For this position, the candidate should be familiar with network protocols, network devices including network interface cards, switches, and routers. You should feel comfortable working with large\\-scale distributed systems, in managing the network infrastructure that supports the Azure Cloud infrastructure as well as in designing and building the large\\-scale distributed systems that manage the network.
   

  

 Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Apply knowledge of network technologies to support design, implementation, and operations across datacenters and network sites.
* Translate high\\-level designs into low\\-level plans and collaborate with internal teams and external partners to expand or modify infrastructure.
* Troubleshoot live site issues using problem management tools (e.g., root cause analysis, postmortems), and participate in on\\-call rotations to restore service availability.
* Collaborate across teams to manage network deployments using machine\\-readable definitions and support innovation through new systems and tools.
* Analyze capacity issues and recommend hardware or network component changes to improve performance, working with internal and external stakeholders.
* Perform testing and validation of network devices, identify and locate necessary data, and guide data center teams on hardware maintenance.
* Evangelize best practices in network engineering, participate in postmortems to improve reliability, and share knowledge across teams with tailored communication.


**Qualifications**
**Required/Minimum Qualifications:**
* 5\\+ years technical experience in network design, development, and automation
+ OR Bachelor's Degree in Electrical Engineering, Optical Engineering, Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology, or related field AND 2\\+ years technical experience in network design, development, and automation.
+ OR Master's Degree in Electrical Engineering, Optical Engineering, Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field AND 1\\+ year(s) technical experience in network design, development, and automation.

* 4\\+ years of experience in the networking Industry or large\\-scale data center network.
* 1\\+ years experience working with L2/L3 switching platforms, application networking and network protocols like BGP, ISIS, MPLS, OSPF, VRRP, LACP, Traffic Engineering Knowledge of Datacenter Design (Control plane \\& Data Plane) \\& Operations
* 1\\+ years experience working in large scale data center/cloud environment with an understanding of passive components (UTP Cabling, Optical cabling).
* 1\\+ years experience in one or more programming languages: C\\+\\+, Java, Python, Perl.


**Other Qualifications**
* Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings:
+ Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud Background Check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.


**Additional Or Preferred Qualifications**
* 8\\+ years technical experience in network design, development, and automation
+ OR Bachelor's Degree in Electrical Engineering, Optical Engineering, Computer Science, Information Technology,
+ OR related field AND 5\\+ years technical experience in network design, development, and automation
+ OR Master's Degree in Electrical Engineering, Optical Engineering, Computer Science, Information Technology,
+ OR related field AND 3\\+ years technical experience in network design, development, and automation
+ OR Doctorate Degree in Electrical Engineering, Optical Engineering, Computer Science, Information Technology,
+ OR related field.

* 1\\+ years experience in understanding and authoring machine readable formats like XML, JSON.
* Excellent communication skills and team player with ability to build solid relationships at all levels, across teams, geographies, and business functions.
* Excellent judgment, decision\\-making skills, and the ability to work under continual deadline pressure when the situation is ambiguous.
* Proficient negotiation skills and conflict management skills.


 Note : By applying to this position you will be assesed for other roles, which requires similar skills.
   

  

 \\#azurecorejobs
   

  

 Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.
